intro: Lightfootia anomala, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its foliage is often velvety and dark green, with flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. Lightfootia anomala is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
